title: GENTLE}: A Genre-Diverse Multilayer Challenge Set for {E}nglish {NLP} and Linguistic Evaluation
authors:
Aoyama, Tatsuya  and
Behzad, Shabnam  and

venue: Proceedings of the 17th Linguistic Annotation Workshop (LAW-XVII)
abstract: We present GENTLE, a new mixed-genre English challenge corpus totaling 17K tokens and consisting of 8 unusual text types for out-of-domain evaluation: dictionary entries, esports commentaries, legal documents, medical notes, poetry, mathematical proofs, syllabuses, and threat letters. GENTLE is manually annotated for a variety of popular NLP tasks, including syntactic dependency parsing, entity recognition, coreference resolution, and discourse parsing. We evaluate state-of-the-art NLP systems on GENTLE and find severe degradation for at least some genres in their performance on all tasks, which indicates GENTLEâ€™s utility as an evaluation dataset for NLP systems.
